newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan stocks seen firm on prospect of reforms.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan stocks seen firm on prospect of reforms.

text.p: Pakistani stocks are likely to open firm on Sunday after the new finance chief set out reforms which could attract funds from the International Monetary Fund and the World Bank, dealers said.

"Any reform promising favour of international agencies would get positive response," one dealer said adding most investors had confidence in Shahid Javed Burki, the new finance chief. On Thursday, the Karachi Stock Exchange 100-share index fell 70.08 points, or 4.43 percent, to end at 1,510.16 amid 171 losers and 33 gainers. Turnover fell to 66.78 million shares from 84.41 million in the previous session. -- Ovais Subhani 9221-5685192
